fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: A boycott is a deliberate and public refusal to participate in an election by a candidate or party who is eligible to participate.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: In this national election, did any registered opposition candidates or parties boycott?

fxInfo_responses.value: Total. All opposition parties and candidates boycotted the election.
Significant. Some but not all opposition parties or candidates boycotted but they constituted a major opposition force.
Ambiguous. Some but not all opposition parties or candidates boycotted but it is unclear whether they would have constituted a major electoral force.
Minor. A few opposition parties or candidates boycotted and they were relatively insignificant ones.
Nonexistent. No parties or candidates boycotted the elections.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2elboycot, *_osp, *_ord
